reviewText: I watched the VHS version purchased some years ago. I am a big Timothy Dalton fan but this is far from his best work. The scenes are disconnected and the sound quality is poor. The Irish accent gets in the way of understanding conversations, and therefore the plot. Having spent some time in Northern Ireland, I know the history of the IRA "revolution" but if not for the news stories of that time, the story would not be revealed very well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another great film based on the English master novelist Gerald Seymour's book titled "Field of Blood". I bought this on VHS tape because the DVD version isn't available over here, and the region 2 version has approx. 15 minutes of the original footage cut out of it so I didn't want to go that route. Instead, I'm going to have this video tape converted locally to a DVD format. Great film - captivating from start to finish!!
summary: Good film - as all of the movies based on Gerald Seymour books are...!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm so disappointed this is not on DVD. I don't want to be without a copy, so I bought two used copies--the second for backup in case anything happens to the first. This is a compelling story with great acting. The integrity of the character that Elwes portrays is inspiring and memorable. It is available on DVD, but only in a Region 2 format. I hope it will someday be offered in a Region 1.
summary: so good that I bought it twice
Title: N/A

reviewText: Above average film about one man's decision to get out of the IRA (easier said than done) by turning "informant" (hence the name of the movie).  Other than Timothy Dalton's usual overacting, the performances all around are quite good - a very worthwhile movie with excellent music by The Pogues and Shane McGowan.
summary: Better than average look at the Troubles
